unnormalised: UPI transactions in India hit a new high in Oct '24, reaching a whopping ₹12 lakh crore! Seems like everyone's ditching cash faster than you can say "server down for maintenance".
normalised: U-P-I transactions in India hit a new high in October two thousand and twenty four, reaching a whopping rupee twelve lakh crore! Seems like everyone's ditching cash faster than you can say "server down for maintenance".

unnormalised: Reports suggest that Paytm, PhonePe, and Google Pay are battling it out for market share, offering cashback and discounts so aggressive, it's practically legalized robbery (in a good way, for the consumer, of course). One user in Bangalore apparently managed to get ₹50 cashback on a ₹20 chai. #blessed #digitalindia
normalised: Reports suggest that Paytm, PhonePe, and Google Pay are battling it out for market share, offering cashback and discounts so aggressive, it's practically legalized robbery (in a good way, for the consumer, of course). One user in Bangalore apparently managed to get rupee fifty cashback on a rupee twenty chai. hash blessed hash digital India

unnormalised: But hold on, folks. While the numbers are impressive, let's not forget the occasional OTP mishaps and the dreaded "Transaction Failed" screen. It's like a suspense thriller, will your payment go through before the auto-rickshaw driver loses his patience? Place your bets!
normalised: But hold on, folks. While the numbers are impressive, let's not forget the occasional O-T-P mishaps and the dreaded "Transaction Failed" screen. It's like a suspense thriller, will your payment go through before the auto-rickshaw driver loses his patience? Place your bets!

unnormalised: On a serious note, this surge in digital payments is a win for financial inclusion. Now even your dadi can pay for her online saree purchase using UPI, although she still might ask you to double-check if she entered the correct amount (it's ₹2500, not ₹25000, Dadi!).
normalised: On a serious note, this surge in digital payments is a win for financial inclusion. Now even your dadi can pay for her online saree purchase using U-P-I, although she still might ask you to double-check if she entered the correct amount (it's rupee two thousand and five hundred, not rupee twenty five thousand, Dadi!).
